stories.title: Version Info
stories.body:
Version: 17.12b beta


New Features

  • Audio and Video support along with Big File Support
  • Topics are shown in the primary language you selected. This is also true for interests.
  • Slightly better inline markdown parsing, as well as the ability to use markdown code syntax. (Here's some code)


Audio Example


3 Doors Down - Away from the Sun


Video Example

Keynote - Rust - confident, productive systems programming by Aaron Turon

stories.title: Mp3 Test on Firefox
stories.body: Audio upload doesn't work on Firefox.

responses.body: Goto you name in the top right, there is a dropdown that will show the link stories. Click that. Then at the bottom of the box of the story you want to edit, there is a down arrow, hover over that to see a dropdown with the button Edit Story. Click that.

I am probably never going to allow markdown images because I don't wan't people linking images from the clearnet. Also, I haven't implemented CORS, so you can't link to an image on another zite yet anyways.
This is the BETA version of the zite, which is one version ahead of the official zite. It should be noted that upon release of new version to this BETA zite, all user content is deleted.

I am also not going to do raw markdown because there's no point. Inline markdown is essentially the same, and better imo. Almost anything you can do in markdown you can do with this editor. Raw markdown offers no benefit and I think it would just be a waste of time.

However, I do want to add the option to import and export markdown.

I don't use any markdown parser because the editor wouldn't work very well with this. I just created a plugin for medium-editor that automatically converts different markdown patterns into their visual representations by using commands provided by medium-editor (and actually contenteditable, because that's what medium-editor is based on). You can find this plugin here: https://github.com/krixano/ZeroMedium/blob/master/src/medium-editor-plugins/inline-markdown.js (Also, looks like there is a problem with markdown links right now).
